sentences.en: A new telegraph line has been set up between the two cities.
sentences.cn: 那两个城市之间架设了一条新的电报线.

sentences.en: Developments in South Africa receive extensive coverage in The Sunday Telegraph.
sentences.cn: 《星期日电讯报》全面报道了南非的发展。

sentences.en: He will place an announcement in the personal column of The Daily Telegraph.
sentences.cn: 他将在《每日电讯报》的个人专栏上登一则启事。

sentences.en: I ghosted his weekly rugby column for the Telegraph.
sentences.cn: 我为他代写《电讯报》每周的橄榄球专栏。

sentences.en: I will tell the result by telegraph.
In modern times, people have communicated by letter, telegraph , and telephone.
sentences.cn: 在现代, 人们用信, 传真, 电话通信.

sentences.en: Mather was film critic on the Daily Telegraph for many years.
sentences.cn: 马瑟多年来一直担任《每日电讯报》的影评人。

sentences.en: Once he knew where we were, Lewis telegraphed every few hours.
sentences.cn: 一知道我们在哪里，刘易斯就每隔几小时发一份电报来。

sentences.en: Please send me my address at this telegraph office.
Send the message on the telegraph.
sentences.cn: 这个消息用电报机发出.

sentences.en: The bush telegraph tells me you're likely to become our new president, John.
sentences.cn: 约翰,我从非官方消息得知,你可能会当选为我们的新校长.

sentences.en: The telegraph has been cut between the two cities.
sentences.cn: 这两座城市之间的电报业务已经中断.

sentences.en: The telegraph ticked out a message.
sentences.cn: 发报机滴滴答答地发出电报.

sentences.en: The truck crashed into a telegraph pole.

words.tran_cn: 电信的；电报的；电报机的

trans.tran_cn: 电报，电讯，电报机，信号机
trans.tran_en: an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
to send a message by telegraph

trans.tran_cn: 用电报发送，打电报向（某人）发指令，电汇，电购
打电报，流露出，电汇，用电报通知
